contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) that "the tent of meeting" specifies the other name for "the tabernacle" (UDB) or 2) "the sanctuary of the tent of meeting." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: the tabernacle, the tent of meeting

contextId.information: These two phrases refer to the same well. The second specifies which well in Bethlehem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: well of Bethlehem, the well at the gate

contextId.information: Both the words "tent" and "tabernacle" describe the same thing and emphasize that he had lived in a place that was not a permanent building. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "great" and "awesome" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of greatness. AT: "very awesome deeds." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words share similar meanings and refer to all of the items and lands that the king owned. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases share similar meanings and emphasize that David and the people of Israel are family. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Both descriptions emphasize the same thing, namely that David had killed people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: a man of war and have shed blood

contextId.information: The phrase "to carry out" means basically the same thing as "keep." Together the words emphasize importance of doing what God commands. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: keep and try to carry out

contextId.information: The words "power" and "might" mean the same thing and emphasize the greatness of Yahweh's power. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: In your hand is power and might
